item.title: Slurp in Perl
item.description: We all know, in Perl v5.36, a new command line flag -g was introduced. For more information you can checkout PPC-0011 The new flag sets $/ (input record separator) to undef and therefore enables slurp mode. It’s simply an alias for -0777. Those who are old enough, might remember this -0777 magical number. So what is -0777? As per the official documentation: -0[octal/hexadecimal] specify record separator (\0, if no argument) 0777 corresponds to the decimal value 511.
